candidates.title: New configuration options for modules
Let's turn this into mx-tester 0.3.0
candidates.body: This is basically a bunch of fixes to adapt to several breakages caused by Synapse changes.

candidates.title: Update for clap 3.1
candidates.body: I removed the `use::clap` because it conflicts with our own `Command` struct

candidates.title: [Fix] Take down the network at the end of down()
candidates.body: This should reduce Docker hogging down resources *across reboots*.

candidates.title: Use Docker's autoretry instead of brute force manual retry
candidates.body: This simplifies the code and seems to work at least as well.

candidates.title: Attempt to retry when Synapse won't start.
candidates.body:
We are regularly faced with the following situations:

1. Synapse cannot open its port (even if we have just checked that the port is open)
   therefore it doesn't actually start; or
2. Synapse starts but stops immediately, having received a SIGTERM from origin
   unknown.

In both situations, mx-tester believes that Synapse has started but this is actually
incorrect.

With this change, we attempt to detect both cases. Once Docker claims that Synapse
has started, we attempt a few times to login to Synapse. If this fails, we conclude
that Synapse has stopped/never truly started and we attempt once again to start
Synapse.

candidates.title: Making tests pass on GitLab
candidates.body:
Took a few days of investigation, but the gist of it seems to be:

1. We need to put temporary files in `/builds/$CI_PROJECT_PATH/tmp` instead of `/tmp`.
2. We need to connect to the Docker registry, rather than trusting the daemon's default behavior.

candidates.title: Implement the equivalent of `docker login`.
candidates.body: Apparently, we need this feature to execute mx-tester as part of GitLab CI.

candidates.title: Version 0.2.2
Experimenting with GitHub Actions and docker
Tightening error handling.
Catching up on stuff that I landed on the wrong repo
